result_list.explanation: Il le suit. (He follows him.) This indicates a character movement, following another character.
Il parle à Haly. (He speaks to Haly.) This indicates a non-verbal interaction, as the stage direction specifies to whom the character is speaking.
AIR. Ah ! que je me lasse d'être. (AIR. Ah! How I tire of being.) This indicates a music stage direction, specifying the name of the tune.
result_list.stgdir: AIR. Ah ! que je me lasse d'être.

result_list.explanation: Frédéric emmène Ferdinand. (Frédéric takes Ferdinand away.) This indicates a character movement, taking another character away.
Air. À la façon de Barbari. (Air. In the manner of Barbari.) This indicates a music stage direction, specifying the name of the tune.
result_list.stgdir: Air. À la façon de Barbari.

result_list.explanation: Air : La danse n'eslpas Ce que j'aime. (Air: Dancing is not what I love.) This indicates a music stage direction, specifying the name of the tune.
result_list.stgdir: Air : La danse n'eslpas Ce que j'aime.

result_list.explanation: Lucile et Damis sortent. (Lucile and Damis exit.) This indicates a character exit.
Il s'en va et il emporte le couplet. (He goes away and takes the verse with him.) This indicates a character exit.
result_list.stgdir: Il s'en va et il emporte le couplet.

result_list.explanation: Il lui montre le portrait d'Élise qu'il a au bras. (He shows him the portrait of Élise that he has on his arm.) This indicates an interaction with an object, showing a portrait.
result_list.stgdir: Il lui montre le portrait d'Élise qu'il a au bras.

result_list.explanation: Apercevant Cléon. (Seeing Cléon.) This indicates a non-verbal interaction, seeing a character.
